title: IBCC revamping examination system to boost students’ capacity
content:
ISLAMABAD, Jan 10 (APP):Executive Director of the Inter-Boards Coordination Committee (IBCC), Dr. Ghulam Ali Mallah, on Friday, announced that the IBCC was working on a plan to introduce the conceptual base examination to enhance the student’s learning capacity.
He made the announcement following the signing of a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between IBCC and the National Press Club here at the NPC.
Talking to the media in Meet the Press, he said that the attestation of certificates was a time-consuming process that had been addressed with initiatives like express courier service and multiple shifts.
“We are generating new ideas on a daily basis for the betterment of the students and education,” he remarked.
He also mentioned that execution or implementation of the policies was a big challenge for the organizations, but we were focusing on it to bring development to the education system.
The grading and education system was going to be changed in the country, and IBCC would organize seminars and workshops for awareness and understanding, he said.
The signing of the MoU with NPC would pave the way for the children of journalists to avail them of the scholarship opportunity, he asserted.
